headline: Heather's Cilantro, Black Bean, and Corn Salsa
description: This black bean and corn salsa is a pretty summer salad of corn, beans, tomato, onion, pepper, and avocado that can be served as an appetizer or side.

video.description: See how to make a lively corn relish for chips or as a side.
video.name: Heather's Cilantro, Black Bean, and Corn Salsa

name: Heather's Cilantro, Black Bean, and Corn Salsa
recipeIngredient: 2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed
1 (14.5 ounce) can Italian-style diced tomatoes, drained
1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
2 tablespoons olive oil, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together black beans, yellow and white corn, tomatoes, cilantro, green onions, red onion, bell pepper, and garlic in a large bowl.
Gently mix in lime juice and avocado. Drizzle with olive oil to serve.

review.reviewBody: So fresh! Have made this several times. Love, love, love!
Iâ€™ve been making this salsa for about 3 years. Thank you Heather
I have been making this for a long time, just decided to do a review. I double it for pot lucks.
Instead of using Italian style diced tomatoes I used 1 1/2 cans of Rotel Hot diced tomatoes. I make this recipe alot!

This is a great recipe. We added a packet of Great Seasons Italian Dressing mix and stirred it in with the lime juice and oil. Adds a little extra kick. This is a family favorite and never lasts whenever we make it, even though we always do a double batch.
I love this recipe! Also added Franks Sweet Chili sauce for some spice!

Well I thought it seemed more like a salad than a salsa. When I think of salsa I think of like a sauce and this was not saucy at all no juice and I also thought it was too much cilantro although I do love cilantro. So next time I think I will leave the sauce in the tomato and also add some store bought fresh salsa sauce. But otherwise very tasty.
Delicious!! A family favorite at our house.
Delicious! Definitely use fresh garden tomatoes instead of canned.
I halved the recipe, and didn't have avocado, but it was still excellent. Even my non bean eating husband enjoyed it. Made it twice in one week!

Fantastic!! I made exactly as written but used fresh summer corn instead of canned. I will probably use fresh tomatoes next time too but the the diced canned was great. After everything was mixed, I added seasoning to taste. This makes a TON! Was a 4th of July crowd pleaser with chips, and went well in our chicken fajita burritos two days later. Highly recommend.
Big hit for Father's Day 2020! It was eaten quickly! Served with nacho chips. Will definitely make this again.

Such a fun and easy dish to make! I made it as a topper for our taco Tuesday night. I excluded the avocado (we had guacamole) and added a splash of apple cider vinegar, garlic powder, and black pepper! Currently eating it, as is, for lunch!
Very good. I didn't have any lime at home unfortunately so I used some balsamic vinegar instead and it was really good.
Delicious, just a little time consuming to cut everything up.

Great recipe. I used regular frozen corn, not the canned corn, used fresh jalapenos, & didn't use the scallions. It turned out great. The beautiful thing about cooking is that you can tailor the recipe to how you like it. Would make again.

I have loved this for years, I use it as a vegan main dish at a barbecue! Very healthy and just delicious! I always use frozen corn and fresh tomatoes, and omit the onion. I'd probably sub a second red pepper for the avocados, too.
Halved the recipe, used. A plum tomato I stared of canned and used my newly purchased garlic cilantro balsamic vinegar. Excellent!
Excellent! I added 2 Tbsp. taco seasoning mix. I served it as salsa with tortilla chips and as a topping on chicken nachos. No leftovers!

Loved this! Made it exactly as per the recipe. Definitely a favorite and I plan to to take to lunch this week. 

Thanks for sharing this on. :)

EDIT: I left out the red pepper because I'm not a fan of raw red peppers. Still great.
I am speechless it is so good!
This is such a great recipe! Weâ€™ve made it many times. Mi add a small minced jalapeÃ±o as well.

From a lot of the reviews it looks like they opted out of using avocado d/t it turning brown. Kitchen Tip: if you squeeze lemon juice or lime juice over the diced avocado (coating all sides) it slows the oxidation time incredibly so you can still enjoy adding this healthful and delicious fruit/veg without it going brown! Enjoy!
I took this to my weight group TOPS, for a tasting day, and they loved the dish. I added Miss Dash, and Garbanzos beans.
Made this 2 nights ago and it was really delicious with Route 11 Sweet Potato Chips
Excellent recipe!!

I made this recipe a few times now, always using fresh corn on the cob instead of the canned. I would also suggest using fresh tomatoes instead of the canned, diced tomatoes. GREAT summer salad for parties or with chicken or fish. It's become my go-to salad/side dish!
Will make this recipe again
I thought this was very good. Was a *bit* too lime-y, but this may not be a bad thing depending on your tastes

Incredibly easy to make. I prepared it the night before to bring to the office. Added the avocados and a splash of lime at the end and it was a success. Served it with tortilla chips. Will definitely prepare it again.
Easy and delicious
I would certainly make it again It was delicious with chips or on tacos

I made this two days ago. It was delicious! I didnâ€™t add any oil. I added a little cumin (like others suggested) and a dash of red wine vinegar. Served this with quinoa and then made burritos yesterday. Will make again! :D

I made this but left out the oil and pepper. I used real tomatoes instead of canned and added a little cumin and a dash of salt. I also threw in some shredded chicken and served it on tostadas with cotija cheese crumbled on top!! So Yummy!!

Big hit for New Years party. Really good. 
Only changes were I used Rotelâ€™s diced green chili and tomatoes, instead of plain tomatoes, and pan roasted 
Frozen corn instead of using canned.
In Japan, and could not find white corn. Everyone loved it!
great recipe. have made many times and is always a hit.
had no lime juice on hand, so i substituted a splash or two of italian dressing in place of the olive oil and lime juice....still delish!
Will definitely make this one again! The only difference I made was to leave out the 5 green onions (too many onions for me). This is a refreshing salsa perfect to have with tortilla chips.
Itâ€™s always a big hit, Iâ€™ve made it on several occasions everyone raves over it. Itâ€™s one of my side when grilling and my fish fryâ€™s. I love it.

Made it with only 2 small changes. Had no green onions, so used sweet onion, (I def think green would be better), and put in about 1/4 of the juice drained from the tomatoes.

We started eating it right away, but I expect it will be even better after a day or two in the frig, allowing flavors to marry.

A KEEPER! Would be pretty for a party.

I made this for a BBQ get-together and it was a big hit! I followed the recipe, adjusting the amount of cilantro as some people do not enjoy its taste. We added some salt and pepper to taste. Already planning to make it again!
This is one of the best of this type of salsa's I've made. It's a keeper for sure.
I made it and put it over grilled chicken. All I can say is ...amazingly delicious!!!! A+++++

Great basic recipe. I had to use cilantro flakes b/c I was in a pinch. Also used straight yellow corn and had to omit the red bell pepper b/c I and none. . Used one can black and one can kidney b/c I was also out. Haha with all the omissions and substitutions it Still turned out great. I also used extra lime juice.

Delicious!! I do use fresh corn when in season (3 ears) and only one can of beans. Subbed a can of original rotel for the tomatoes for a little kick, used 1 tbsp fajita seasoning and 1 tbsp cumin and about 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes. Left out cilantro (donâ€™t like it) but used fresh parsley instead. Very yummy!!!
Everyone loved it!
Needs a little more garlic and a jalapeno if you like a little stronger flavor, but overall a great recipe!
I loved this salad! It was easy to make, extremely healthy and super delicious!!!! I will definitely make it again.
It was perfect.
The best version of this we've tried...to make it quicker this time we used a couple of cups of premade pico and it came together so quickly
This is good. It needs salt and jalapenos and a few more spices though. Cumin, maybe?
This is good. It needs salt and jalapenos and a few more spices though. Cumin, maybe?
This is so tasty...I made it for my son's birthday, who is vegan and he loved it...will be making this again, again and again
Great dip! I added some vinegar which gave it a little more punch.. and took to a tailgate. I got lots of compliments and it looks so pretty on the table!
I used fresh, ripe tomatoes and lime juice. It was fabulous.
Tastes fresh and wonderful.

This was great! It says 72 servings which threw me. I only wanted for four so I had to re-figure the portions. I guess 72 is for dip at a party. I did about 1/4 of each ingredient. But it turned out very well as a side dish for steak tortillas. I added some cumin, jalapano and chili peppers.

I substituted guacamole pico de gallo in place of avocado and used two cans of fire roasted diced tomatoes instead of one. Based on personal preference I left out the pepper. Since the guacamole made it so creamy I didn't need the oil and it was really easy to scoop with a chip. This is one of those great recipes where it is good on its own, but allows you to tweak as you like. It makes a very large amount which makes it great for parties.

Fantastic recipe, the only tweak I would make is that I would add a second can of tomatoes and wait to put the avocado on as the absolute last step. We mixed it all together and the avocado got pulverized, next time I may leave them on the side. This recipe goes PERFECT with burritos, definitely a favorite!
I made this and second go around I used salt and the olive oil on the niblet corn that I roasted first and also used roasted red peppers. Fresh lime juice and fresh cilantro is a must.
Very good. Many compliments. Deli pico de gallo is the way go to go vs chopped tomatoes.

I made this salsa tonight..it's probably my favorite salsa..I changed just a few things..I didn't have green onions or bell pepper so I left those out..and I added fresh tomatoes instead of canned..everything else I left as is..it was a huge success!! I will definitely be making this again..
Loved it.. But i I did double the amount of lime juice.
The only change we made was to use fire roasted canned tomatoes instead of Italian. Turned out perfect!
This is addictive and everyone loved it! I made it exactly per directions except added a little more lime juice...

Used a combination of canned tomatoes and fresh. Canned tomatoes were slime-y. Added packet of taco seasoning, extra cumin, oregano, red pepper and still no taste. Left to marinate overnight in hopes of saving... still no taste. Glad I had a backup for guests.
We don't care for cilantro so substituted flat leaf parsley. This is a keeper and will be made again.

We made this for New Year's Eve, served it with chips and all of us loved it. I will use leftovers to top salads this week.

 I used a 10-ounce can of Ro*Tell tomatoes instead of diced tomatoes. I used red and green bell pepper to make it pretty. 
For good luck purposes for New Year's tradition in the South, I threw in a ladle or two of black-eyed peas from a pot of them I already had simmering on the stove for the next day.
followed the recipe as is. very delicious. enjoyed it with my fish tacos.. yum !
Really liked this recipe as an alternative to the usual salsa. Great eith chips. I served it with grilled fish.
Loved this!!!
This is easy to make and has quickly become by must make party item. Everyone loves it and never have to worry about leftover!

I used fire roasted yellow corn and fire roasted tomatoes. I also added roasted red peppers in addition to the red bell pepper. I wanted to keep some crisp, fresh crunch to the salad. So l didn't omit the bell pepper. The salsa was more smoky. Still, very delicious.
Being from New Mexico, substitute the bell peppers with roasted green chiles.
Made this for family Fourth of July gathering. Very well received. Made some changes after reading other reviews. Added cumin, extra lime juice, salt and lots of fresh cilantro.

This salsa is so delicious!!! Made it as an appetizer before a Mexican dish I made and our guest could not stop eating it! My girlfriend loved it so much I gave her the recipe. This is one of my husband's favorites!

So I took this recipe, as I do with all my recipes I find online, and changed it just slightly.

So I don't like using canned things so I used fresh corn (2 ears) and fresh beans (1.5 cups, dry). I also used fresh garlic (your recipe didn't specify) and fresh tomatoes (two Roma and a handful of cherry). I added other seasonings to taste ( garlic salt, paprika, chili powered, pinch of cumin, and Tony's creole seasoning). 

I kept everything else the same. Since I cooked dry beans the recipe time was much longer however if you have the beans pre cooked the time is about the same. (An additional 2-3 hours if dry beans are pre cooked).
FANTASTIC RECIPE!! I made this to put on my fish tacos. Great addition to a dish or just using as a dip with chips. I wouldn't change a thing!

This recipe was so good. I made it for a barbecue at my sister's house. I admitted the Purple Onion and added mango a little sugar and some white vinegar within the first 15 minutes the entire Bowl was gone. I served it with the line corn chips and they paired together perfectly. Thank you so much for this recipe.

This salsa was delicious. The only thing I did differently was use fresh tomatoes rather than canned tomatoes and added some salt. I made this for a potluck & it received rave reviews. Will definitely be making this again & again!
Wow! This was amazing! My whole family thought that I bought this! I did use fresh tomatoes instead of canned and didn't use any olive oil. Super amazing! Will definitely be making this again!
I love how this is so great as is, or it can be easily altered to suit your own tastes. Using garden fresh ingredients would put this to a 6 star or higher recipe!!??

I have made something similar, there are a million variations. I will say that when sweet corn is in season, next time you fire up the grill, roast a few extra ears of corn just for this. It is SOOOO much better than canned.

My family and I love this recipe! I have always made salsa, but when I saw this version, I could not resist. The only changes that I made were: I slightly heat the black beans and corn for a minute with the garlic. This gives it more texture when it comes to the blending process. I also used fresh tomatoes instead of canned, a small jalapeÃ±o pepper seeded for a little kick and a teaspoon of distilled vinegar. I omitted the avocado. I will definitely make it again! Great recipe! Thanks!!!
Great recipe used it a couple times now. Everyone raves about it. I add a couple extra things like jalapeÃ±os. Black pepper. Basil. Chili powder. Salt.

I followed this recipe exactly and ended up making it twice in one week! The only thing I did was roast the red pepper on my gas stove. I will make this at home and in my food classes! Great with chips, on enchiladas, in a taco, or on a burger... extremely versatile!
We loved this salsa. We used fresh tomato instead of canned, added Italian dressing mix (per other recipes), salt and pepper. We omitted the red bell pepper and green onion due to preference.
Definitely will make again. Next time going to add jalapeÃ±os. It needed a little more kick, but very flavorful and colorful.

Love it but use it a bit differently, I make it and fill flour or corn tortillas with it adding cheddar cheese and sour cream to make dinner wraps on crazy busy nights for a quick dinner on the go!
A couple of things I do different: I use leftover cooked corn on the cob instead of canned, substitute a can of Rotel for the tomatoes, or use fresh depulped.
This is a good salsa and you can adjust it according to your taste. I did not have cilantro, so I didn't add it, but I added a little jarred salsa for extra zest and omitted the oil. It was a hit!
I have made this more times than I can count - perfect with chips, or in tacos, and in salads. This is a summer staple in our house!
if I make for a party, I have to make extra for the wife... the longer it sits the better it gets....
Gave out recipe at our outing! Used basil instead of cilantro and no avacado due to hubby. Used fresh cooked corn and fresh tomatoes, cumin, garlic and a few other spices, it really is good.
So good! I threw in a little Italian dressing just for fun!
Came out wonderfully! I added extra avocado just because, and a little salt. Except for the beans, everything was freshly chopped instead of a can.
Love, love, love! Didn't change a thing! The kids like it too and it's healthy!

I added 1 teaspoon of Cumin, Chilling Powder, Salt , Pepper, Cayenne Pepper and substituted the Olive Oil with 6 shots of 100% Blue Agave Tequila,then added 3 jalapeÃ±o, 2 pablamo and 4 Habenaro Peppers yeeee Hawwww! 5 1/2 stars
This is a request for every social gathering I attend! I mix everything together the day before and add the avocado the day of! Excellent recipe, light and refreshing!

item.name: Heather's Cilantro, Black Bean, and Corn Salsa
